page.title: 12LANDSCAPE
page.content: The landscape is flat to gently rolling and is mainly used for arable farming.There are small areas of semi_ natural woodland.Hedgerows lost much of their timber due to Dutch elm disease and have not yet recovered There are considerable reserves of gravel which are causing changes, exhausted workings being converted to farm reservoirs.Recently permission to convert has been refused.Few water courses cross the area_streams originating as farm drainage systems. Apart from modern village development there are well spaced farmhouses and buildings most of timber construction dating from 14th to 18th century.
